item.title: Intermittent Closures of Pedestrian Pathway to Restore Lake Elizabeth Area
item.description: For BART to do this work, the pedestrian sidewalk will be closed for brief periods on several days beginning March 19, and for a full day on March 20 and on April 9.

item.title: Electronic Plan Check
item.description: Applicants can now submit their drawings for plan review via email!!

item.title: South Fremont/Warm Springs Strategy – A Turn-Around Plan for Tomorrow’s Job Center
item.description: The City has produced a Jobs Recovery Strategy, which outlines a plan for revitalization of an 850-acre area surrounding the new Tesla Factory.

item.title: Copper Wire Theft from City Street Lights
item.description: In the past seven months, copper wire theft repairs have cost the City approximately $460,000 and left many street lights dark until repaired.

item.title: New Police Website Unveiled
item.description: The Fremont Police Department has unveiled its new website, which comes complete with easier navigation, custom communications, and a user-friendly design.

item.title: Dissolution of the Fremont Redevelopment Agency
item.description: The City Council voted to make the City of Fremont the Successor Redevelopment Agency; it's responsible for winding down the former functions of the RDA.

item.title: City Council Appoints Gus Morrison as New Mayor
item.description: The Council appointed Gus Morrison as Fremont's new mayor on January 30 at a Special Council Meeting. He was sworn in to office on January 31.

item.title: Fremont Welcomes New Planning Manager
item.description: Kristie Wheeler is Fremont's new Planning Manager. She comes to the City with both public and private sector experience.

item.title: Planned BART Construction Activities
item.description: Activities related to the BART Warm Springs Extension Project are set to expand south of Central Park all the way to the Warm Springs Station site near South Grimmer Boulevard.

item.title: Fremont Mayor Bob Wasserman Passes Away at 77
item.description: Mayor Bob Wasserman, who had been Mayor of Fremont since 2004, passed away on December 29, 2011, at the Fremont Kaiser facility in the presence of his family. He was 77.

item.title: New Interactive Map for Art in Fremont’s Public Places
item.description: The City and the Fremont Cultural Arts Council have teamed up to develop this map, which provides a virtual tour of more than 40 pieces of art.

item.title: PG&E's Russell City Energy Center Interconnection Project
item.description: At the Dumbarton Substation in Fremont, construction activity includes transmission tower upgrades and replacing old power lines with new lines.

item.title: City Launches Social Media Pilot Program
item.description: Connect with us, follow us, and view us on several new social networking sites, including Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube

item.title: New Paperless Council Agenda Process
item.description: The City has introduced a new paperless Council Agenda process. This new technology will provide cost savings and efficiencies.

item.title: Route 238 (Mission Blvd.) Rehabilitation Project
item.description: Expect delays on Mission Boulevard from just north of I-680 to Blanche Street (in Hayward) for an extended period of time.

item.title: City Council Approves Ordinance to Reduce Number of Council Meetings
item.description: Change from four to three meetings per month to begin in September.

item.title: Strategic Sustainability Study
item.description: The City's Strategic Sustainability Study is complete.

item.title: Route 238 (Mission Blvd.) Rehabilitation Project
item.description: Expect delays on Mission Boulevard from just north of I-680 to Blanche Street (in Hayward) for an extended period of time.

item.title: Fremont is CALED Award of Excellence Grand Prize Winner in Program Category
Fremont is CALED Award of Excellence Grand Prize Winner in Program Category
State of the City Address
item.description: Fremont's mayor presented the annual State of the City address on March 30. It's available to view.

item.title: Federal Economic Stimulus Dollars for Fremont
item.description: City staff has actively submitted project ideas to multiple agencies and interest groups.
